analyzed: sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa'i gzugs gang gis 'khor ba ji srid bar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i don mnyam pa nyid du mdzad pa'i sku de ni rgyun chags pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa'i sku
translated: The body of a buddha, such as Shakyamuni, which acts to fulfill the needs of sentient beings in all worldly realms for as long as samsara lasts, is the emanation body of the transcendent conquerors because it is continuous.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa yin no //

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i bdag nyid bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung ba sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yul nyid du ye shes la sogs pa la ltos nas rab tu brtags pa'i sku gsum bstan nas /

translated: Thus, in dependence on pristine wisdom and so on, the three bodies of a buddha are fully qualified as the objects of meditation that arise from the power of meditation on the nature body.

original: kun rdzob tu ye shes kho na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la sogs par snang ba skyed pa'i sgo nas don bya ba mdzad pas na /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ye shes kho na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la sogs par snang ba skyed pa'i sgo nas don bya ba mdzad pas na /
translated: In terms of the relative, pristine wisdom alone appears as the body of perfect enjoyment and so on and through generating it, buddhas perform benefits for others.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo'i snang ba la brten pa'i las de'i bdag po la brten nas byung ba rnams ni chos kyi sku'i yin no zhes /
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo'i snang ba la brten pa'i las de'i bdag po la brten nas byung ba rnams ni chos kyi sku'i yin no zhes /
translated: Therefore, the three bodies are the body of attributes because they arise in dependence on the dominant condition of the karma of disciples that is to say, the karma that is the cause of their appearance.

original: de bzhin 'khor ba ji srid 'di'i //
analyzed: de bzhin 'khor ba ji srid 'di'i //
translated: Likewise, as long as there is cyclic existence,

original: las 'di rgyun mi 'chad par 'dod //
analyzed: las 'di rgyun mi 'chad par 'dod //

original: 'gro rnams zhi ba'i las dang ni //

translated: the six perfections, the path of the buddhas, and emptiness by nature,🔽the exhaustion of the two,🔽the conventional, the non-apprehension of objects,

analyzed: stong pa nyid dang gnyis zad dang // brda dang dmigs pa med pa dang // lus can rnams ni yongs smin dang // byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang ni //

analyzed: mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa dang // byang @138b chub thob dang sangs rgyas zhing //

analyzed: chud mi za dang bden mthong dang // phyin ci log ni spangs pa dang // de gzhi med pa'i tshul dang ni //

analyzed: rnam par byang dang tshogs dang ni //
translated: Purification, and the accumulations,

translated: In the conditioned and the unconditioned,

analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la bkod de /
translated: them, such as generosity.🔽Having caused them to realize the antidotes and what is to be abandoned

original: sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du rjes su chags pa la sogs pas rnam par dben pa nyid kyis sems can gyi don te gzhan gyi don byams pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba'i bdag nyid la bkod de /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du rjes su chags pa la sogs pas rnam par dben pa nyid kyis sems can gyi don te gzhan gyi don byams pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba'i bdag nyid la bkod de /
translated: The benefit of others, which is the benefit of sentient beings, is the establishment of others in the nature of love, etc., which is the nature of the emptiness of the absence of attachment, etc., like a magician.

original: de'i rjes la rang gi don 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la goms pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la rang gi don 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la goms pa la'o //
translated: After that, one should practice the six perfections, which are distinguished by the purity of the three spheres, for one's own benefit.

original: de'i 'og tu rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi mtshan nyid sangs rgyas kyi lam ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi mtshan nyid sangs rgyas kyi lam ste /
translated: After that, one should practice the path of the Buddha, which is characterized by one's own and others' benefit.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la'o //
translated: That is, on the path of the ten virtuous actions.

original: de nas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid goms pa la'o //
analyzed: de nas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid goms pa la'o //
translated: Then, one should practice the emptiness of inherent existence of all phenomena.

original: de'i rjes la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas sa dang po chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis su med pa'i chos la'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas sa dang po chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis su med pa'i chos la'o //
translated: After that, one should practice the nondual Dharma, which is characterized by the realization of the all-pervading realm of phenomena on the first ground, in dependence on the perfection of generosity.

original: de nas tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur gyur pas sa gnyis pa la sogs par tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos thams cad brdar btags pa'i shes pa la 'god do //
analyzed: de nas tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyur gyur pas sa gnyis pa la sogs par tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos thams cad brdar btags pa'i shes pa la 'god do //
translated: Then, because the accumulations are completely perfected, on the second ground and so on, all the dharmas of the perfections such as ethics are established in the consciousness that is the conventional symbol.

original: de bzhin du rim gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas sa drug pa la shes pa dang / shes bya'i dngos por mngon par ma zhen pa'i mtshan nyid chos thams cad dmigs su @139a * //🔽med pa la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rim gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas sa drug pa la shes pa dang / shes bya'i dngos por mngon par ma zhen pa'i mtshan nyid chos thams cad dmigs su @139a * // med pa la'o //
translated: In the same way, in stages, on the sixth ground, based on the perfection of wisdom, all dharmas are established in the nonapprehension of things that are objects of knowledge and consciousness, which is characterized by nonattachment to things that are objects of knowledge and consciousness.

original: de'i 'og tu sa bdun pa la thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sa bdun pa la thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la'o //
translated: After that, on the seventh ground, all dharmas are established in the nonapprehension of the activity of the mind, which is characterized by the nonapprehension of the activity of the mind that is engaged in the maturation of sentient beings through the power of the perfection of method.

original: de nas stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sa brgyad pa la nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam la'o //
analyzed: de nas stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sa brgyad pa la nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam la'o //
translated: Then, on the eighth ground, all dharmas are established in the nonapprehension of the activity of the mind, which is characterized by the nonapprehension of the activity of the mind that is the bodhisattva path that is not in common with śrāvakas and so on, through the power of the perfection of power.

original: de nas de nyid la chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa spangs pa la'o //
analyzed: de nas de nyid la chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa spangs pa la'o //
translated: Then, on that very stage, they are established in the elimination of all attachment to phenomena.

original: de'i rjes las dgu pa la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthus byang chub thob pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes las dgu pa la smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthus byang chub thob pa la'o //
translated: After that, on the ninth stage, through the power of the perfection of vows, they are established in the attainment of enlightenment.

original: de'i 'og tu ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sa bcu pa la sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs rnam par dag pa la bkod nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis sa bcu pa la sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs rnam par dag pa la bkod nas /
translated: After that, through the power of the perfection of wisdom, on the tenth stage, they are established in the purification of various buddha realms.

original: yang de nyid la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu so sor nges pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gyi don dang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi drung du nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i yon tan la bkod de /
analyzed: yang de nyid la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu so sor nges pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gyi don dang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi drung du nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i yon tan la bkod de /
translated: Then, on that very stage, they are established in the individual certainty of perfect complete enlightenment obstructed by a single birth and in the qualities of benefiting sentient beings in the world systems of the ten directions and going into the presence of the buddhas in all world systems and so on.

original: de lta bu'i rim pas yang de nyid la khyad par gyi lam gyi rang gi ngo bo byang chub mtha' dag 'dren par byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid byang chub kyi yan lag dang / las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa chud mi za ba dang /🔽dngos po thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa dang / phyin ci log thams cad spangs pa dang / phyin ci log gzhi med pa spangs pa'i ye shes dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par byang ba dang /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rim pas yang de nyid la khyad par gyi lam gyi rang gi ngo bo byang chub mtha' dag 'dren par byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid byang chub kyi yan lag dang / las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa chud mi za ba dang / dngos po thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa dang / phyin ci log thams cad spangs pa dang / phyin ci log gzhi med pa spangs pa'i ye shes dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par byang ba dang /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattvas introduce them to the distinctive path of the Great Vehicle, the essence of which is the thirty-seven elements leading to enlightenment, the unmistaken path to the great enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.🔽They introduce them to the knowledge that all things are impermanent, suffering, empty, and devoid of self, and to the knowledge that all phenomena are devoid of attributes and devoid of expectancy.🔽They introduce them to the knowledge that all phenomena are devoid of arising and devoid of cessation, and to the knowledge that they are primordially peace and naturally nirvana.

original: dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i rnam par byang ba'i rgyu'i tshogs dang / stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas tha mi dad par yongs su shes pa la bkod nas /
analyzed: dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i rnam par byang ba'i rgyu'i tshogs dang / stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas tha mi dad par yongs su shes pa la bkod nas /
translated: They introduce them to the knowledge that all phenomena are devoid of entities and devoid of nonentities, and to the knowledge that all phenomena are devoid of existence and nonexistence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la mya ngan las 'da' ba la 'god par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la mya ngan las 'da' ba la 'god par mdzad de /
translated: He causes them to attain nirvana on the tathiigata stage.

translated: Thus, like the dharmakaya, his activity is also twenty-sevenfold, and is performed as long as cyclic existence endures.

original: sems bskyed pa dang po dang tha ma'i las bstan pa'i go rims bstan pa'i rim pas lhag ma bar gyi tshig gi don rnams kyi go rims kyang khong du chud par bya ste /

translated: The order of the remaining topics should be understood in accordance with the order in which the first and last topics are taught.

translated: The culmination of the universal vehicle is the universal vehicle's culmination, because it is the culmination of the universal vehicle's practice.

translated: Then, in order to ascertain the realized object, the successive clear realizations are the occasion of the three knowledges, since they continue the treatise topic of the object meditated on individually and in total.

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: Then, since there is no further progress, the perfect clear realization in one instant is the occasion of the culmination of the three knowledges.

translated: Then, since it is the result of that, the dharma body with its activity is the karmic maturation of the three knowledges.

analyzed: de ltar na yum thams cad kyi don bsdus pa gzhan rnam pa drug ste /

analyzed: snga ma kho na bzhin du bshad par bya ba yin no //
